unnormalised: Hey everyone, I'm trying to figure out how to consolidate all my IDs. It's a real mess! I have my college registration number: REG/2018/IITD/123, which I needed for everything back then. Then there's my employee ID from TCS: TCS12345. Plus, I recently took the CAT exam, and my registration number is 230514789. It's insane!
normalised: Hey everyone, I am trying to figure out how to consolidate all my I-D-s. It is a real mess! I have my college registration number: R-E-G slash two thousand and eighteen slash I-I-T-D slash one hundred and twenty three, which I needed for everything back then. Then there is my employee I-D from T-C-S: T-C-S one two three four five. Plus, I recently took the C-A-T exam, and my registration number is two three zero five one four seven eight nine. It is insane!

unnormalised: Seriously, managing all these IDs is a headache. Do you guys have any tips on how to keep track of them all? I'm thinking of creating a spreadsheet or something. I also have my GATE exam roll no. XL2023678910. I think using a password manager might be useful, but I'm worried about security.
normalised: Seriously, managing all these I-D-s is a headache. Do you guys have any tips on how to keep track of them all? I am thinking of creating a spreadsheet or something. I also have my G-A-T-E exam roll no. X-L two zero two three six seven eight nine one zero. I think using a password manager might be useful, but I am worried about security.

unnormalised: Adding to the confusion, each certificate seems to use a slightly different format. My class 10th board exam roll number from CBSE is A1234567. Why can't they just stick to one system? It would make everyone's life so much easier. And now I am thinking of applying for jobs. I'll have a bunch of new IDs to remember.
normalised: Adding to the confusion, each certificate seems to use a slightly different format. My class tenth board exam roll number from C-B-S-E is A one two three four five six seven. Why can not they just stick to one system? It would make everyone's life so much easier. And now I am thinking of applying for jobs. I will have a bunch of new I-D-s to remember.

unnormalised: I was also thinking of maybe encrypting a file with all my information and keeping it on a USB drive. That might be a safer option than storing everything online. Also, I heard that there are some apps that help you keep track of your important documents. Maybe I should check some out.
normalised: I was also thinking of maybe encrypting a file with all my information and keeping it on a U-S-B drive. That might be a safer option than storing everything online. Also, I heard that there are some apps that help you keep track of your important documents. Maybe I should check some out.

unnormalised: Anyways, if anyone has any advice or recommendations, please let me know! I'm really looking for some practical solutions to this problem. Thanks in advance for your help! What has worked for you?
normalised: Anyways, if anyone has any advice or recommendations, please let me know! I am really looking for some practical solutions to this problem. Thanks in advance for your help! What has worked for you?
